author: @Boomer250

text:
Even if Ultraviolet offered me their EV bike for free with a bow on top, lifetime charging, service and upgrades...I still wouldn‚Äôt take it. Sell it to someone who likes tech toys. I ride machines not experiments.
Let‚Äôs get brutally honest here..EV bikes like Ultraviolet are flashy, over glorified gadgets. They look good on paper and Instagram reels but in real world Indian conditions? They're a joke! Our roads, weather, dust and distances don‚Äôt care about your digital dashboard or futuristic LED lights ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

My 11 year old Royal Enfield Classic 500 which they don‚Äôt even make anymore...still dominates rough terrains like Ladakh, Himachal, Nepal and the Northeast without skipping a beat. It doesn‚Äôt need an update. It doesn‚Äôt panic if there‚Äôs no charger nearby. It doesn‚Äôt beg for software support or battery calibration. It just rides and roars. Every damn time üëçüç∫ These EVs? They're built for urban coffee shop crawls and weekend flexing not for people who actually live and breathe adventure. Battery anxiety is real. Charging stations are still inconsistent. And once your battery degrades and it will in 2‚Äì4 years in India‚Äôs heat. You‚Äôre left with a useless, overpriced e-brick. And good luck finding a mechanic for that in the middle of nowhere üòÇ
You can cover the whole of India with charging stations and I still won‚Äôt trade a real engine for a silent spin. Torque, reliability, control and soul that‚Äôs what makes a bike a machine. Not circuits and Bluetooth. So no I don‚Äôt want Ultraviolet, even for free ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è I want a bike that bleeds character, not a plastic spaceship with a progress bar üëç

text: Everything about the bike is great, but the price is too high. When we spend 3‚Äì4 lakhs, we get bikes with 47‚Äì50+ BHP. If we compare everything‚Äîrange, features, and performance‚Äîprice dominates all factors. As an Indian, I feel proud that we have made such an impressive EV bike. But what‚Äôs the point if we can only watch it on YouTube? If they don‚Äôt reduce the price, sales will decline. If they try to sell it in foreign countries, the price will increase even more. Let‚Äôs see what happens. If they lower the price and offer the top variant under 3 lakhs, everyone will buy this Ultraviolette.

text: Can anyone provide a real life review of this device.
author: @NirmanParkar

text:
I have purchased this bike in 2024. Performance wise it is good. In Servicing of the bike, they will loot you. No cost savings if you are giving 3000 to 5000 for paid service after your one year service. This will be for every 6 months. So, whatever you are putting for petrol, you are giving it for servicing. Ather would be better if you are looking for cost saving 2 wheeler. If you want performance, and could manage the high servicing cost, go for Ultraviolette f77.

You will not be heard of anything when you are giving for the paid service. They will charge you 3000-5000 no matter what. It will be more if any additional parts are to be replaced. I guess this is where the UV is trying to get most of the money from its customers.üòÖ

The chargers in public are very less as I have seen for now (year 2024 and 2025). It will be very difficult to carry it when there is a pillon rider with you. The service center and the showroom executives will tell us that it will charge in 3 hours with the fast charger. So, I bought the Fast charger when I purchased this bike. However, it will take 4 hours to charge from 10 percent to 100 percent. Even though if you turn it off, there will be battery drainage of 1-2 percent per day even if you are not using any Violette AI feature. 

Violette AI feature: Sometimes, you won't even get notified when someone tries to tamper with your bike. This Violette AI feature costs around 20,000 additional where it is supposed to notify you when someone moves your bike, and the parking lights to blink during regen braking, tow alert , fall alert and when the delta watch is active you can have the break lights to blink every few seconds showing that the feature has been activated. You can turn each of them off but, I don't see any use for it even though I'm seeing them not working most of the time.

I had bought the UV care max package which costed around additional of ‚Çπ50,000. They will  give you a warranty for your battery until 8 years or 8,00,000 kms whichever comes first. If you skip any periodic service, you will void this warranty and you will not be able to claim it in the future. As per my recommendation, please don't go for this package

You have Mapples (MapmyIndia) instead of google. You won't get any direction assistance  in this. It is completely useless as I'm using Google Maps in my phone and attaching it to the handle bar via the Mobile Holder. I've been asking them from past one year, that is from 2024 but, still there is no fix for this solution.

So, overall I could say that there is no word about the performance. It is really good. But the features which they offer for additional price ike Violette AI, UV care battery warranty is not recommended. The servicing cost could be reduced by the company as most of the people would go for the electric vehicles for cost savings.
